pullRequest.title: DB-9682 Restrict columns for CSV external tables to be exact

beforeCommit.message:
DB-9682 Restrict columns for CSV external tables to be exact

While this would also work ignoring additional columns, this would lead
to problems when tables are also used for writing.
PARQUET/ORC also fail if num cols not exact. Accessing fewer columns
can be achieved by using VIEWS or only SELECT parts.

afterCommit.message:
DB-9682 Restrict columns for CSV external tables to be exact

While this would also work ignoring additional columns, this would lead
to problems when tables are also used for writing.
PARQUET/ORC also fail if num cols not exact. Accessing fewer columns
can be achieved by using VIEWS or only SELECT parts.

nodes.bodyText:
I think it is better to do the following:

Make sure you create all tables under the schema you set (line 55). Put all create table statements in the test preamble if possible.
Use unique table names in the same test suite.
Remove all drop statements, the schema watcher will take care of that for you since it is dropping the schema when the test suite is finished.
